
---

<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Provides information about multiple Elastic File System (EFS) Access Points.


{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}

{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Aws = Pulumi.Aws;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var test = Output.Create(Aws.Efs.GetAccessPoints.InvokeAsync(new Aws.Efs.GetAccessPointsArgs
        {
            FileSystemId = "fs-12345678",
        }));
    }

}
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws/sdk/v3/go/aws/efs"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := efs.GetAccessPoints(ctx, &efs.GetAccessPointsArgs{
			FileSystemId: "fs-12345678",
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example python %}}
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_aws as aws

test = aws.efs.get_access_points(file_system_id="fs-12345678")
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example typescript %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as aws from "@pulumi/aws";

const test = pulumi.output(aws.efs.getAccessPoints({
    fileSystemId: "fs-12345678",
}, { async: true }));
```
